column4: It's been 50 minutes and my desktop STILL hasn't started from the Live CD.
Actually, I think I'm gonna bring my laptop into the room here. Can someone Direct Chat me and walk me through as to how I can start the Live CD and get it to work?
At start or install press F6 and remove Quiet and Splash from the command line. If it still fails.. Repeat and after removing quiet and splash add noapic acpi=off before the "--"
It will stop at the error.. making it easier, or it will flag it red
some errors like fd0 are not a big deal
be patient there will be two fd0 errors then it will continue
give it a couple miutes there just to be sure then try those other tow additions to the command line
livecd doesnt do what shutdown on a hd install can do
those two adds are quite common changes
try with those command changes I gave you
Progress is progress
You may still end up using the alternate cd
text based install, no live gui
It is available for free..  it takes awhile.. but they mail it to you
no...   how much ram is in that box
Might as well stop there...
You are probably sharing video ram off that 128
Was it the same version of ubuntu?  and how much ram is being diverted from that 128 to be used for video.  Did the other machine have onboard video or dedicated card
with only 128 minimize how much ram is diverted
Something you should investigate
best to keep it in channel as I am trying to do some other work as well
cool..
Im off to make dinner...
